com.example.as1

Class FightLineup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.as1.FightLineup
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OpponentFightLineup, PlayerFightLineup

    public class FightLineup
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Drew Kinneer, Jack Kelley The FightLineup class manages a lineup of brawlers for a game, setting their stats and retrieving data from a specified URL.

    • Field Summary

      protected boolean allDead()
      The function checks if all the brawlers in the lineup are dead.
      protected FightBrawlerFrame getFrontBrawlerFrame()
      This function returns the first non-dead FightBrawlerFrame object in the lineup.
      protected int randomId()
      The function generates a random integer between 1 and 4 (inclusive).
      protected void setBrawler(int index, Brawler brawler)
      This Java function sets a brawler at a specific index in a lineup, and if the brawler is null, it sets a default brawler.
      protected void setBrawler(int index, int id, int attack, int health, int effectId, BrawlerEffectType brawlerEffect, java.lang.String imageUrl)
      This function sets a brawler in a specific index of a lineup and renders its stats.
      protected void setFrontBrawler(Brawler brawler)
      This function sets a Brawler object as the front brawler in a lineup and renders its stats.
      protected void setFrontBrawlerDead()
      This function sets the front brawler in a lineup as dead.
      protected void setLineup(int accountId, java.lang.String url)
      This function sets the lineup of brawlers for a game by making a GET request to a specified URL and populating the lineup with the retrieved data, while also creating fake dead brawlers to prevent null id checks.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This Java function returns a string representation of a lineup object by iterating through its brawlers and appending their string representations to the output.

      • setLineup

        protected void setLineup(int accountId,
                         java.lang.String url)
        This function sets the lineup of brawlers for a game by making a GET request to a specified URL and populating the lineup with the retrieved data, while also creating fake dead brawlers to prevent null id checks.
        Parameters:
        accountId - The ID of the account for which the lineup is being set.
        url - The URL endpoint to retrieve the lineup data from.

      • setBrawler

        protected void setBrawler(int index,
                          int id,
                          int attack,
                          int health,
                          int effectId,
                          BrawlerEffectType brawlerEffect,
                          java.lang.String imageUrl)
        This function sets a brawler in a specific index of a lineup and renders its stats.
        Parameters:
        index - The index represents the position of the brawler in the lineup. It is an integer value that starts from 0 and goes up to the maximum number of brawlers in the lineup.
        id - The unique identifier of the brawler.
        attack - The attack parameter represents the amount of damage that the brawler can inflict on its opponents. It is a measure of the brawler's offensive capabilities.
        health - The health parameter represents the amount of health points that a brawler has. It determines how much damage the brawler can take before being defeated.
        effectId - The effectId parameter is an integer value that represents the unique identifier of a specific effect that can be applied to a brawler. This effect can modify the brawler's stats or behavior in some way, such as increasing its attack power or causing it to heal over time. The effectId is used
        brawlerEffect - brawlerEffect is an enum type variable that represents the type of effect a brawler has. It is used to set the effectId parameter of the Brawler object. The possible values of BrawlerEffectType are defined elsewhere in the code and could include effects such as stun, poison, or heal
        imageUrl - The URL of the image associated with the brawler.

      • setBrawler

        protected void setBrawler(int index,
                          Brawler brawler)
        This Java function sets a brawler at a specific index in a lineup, and if the brawler is null, it sets a default brawler.
        Parameters:
        index - The index parameter is an integer value that represents the position of the brawler in the lineup array. It is used to identify the specific slot where the brawler will be set.
        brawler - The brawler parameter is an object of the class Brawler, which contains information about a specific character in a game or application. It likely includes attributes such as name, health, attack power, and special abilities.

        protected int randomId()
        The function generates a random integer between 1 and 4 (inclusive).
        Returns:
        An integer value between 1 and 4 (inclusive) generated randomly by the `nextInt()` method of the `Random` class.

      • setFrontBrawlerDead

        protected void setFrontBrawlerDead()
        This function sets the front brawler in a lineup as dead.

      • allDead

        protected boolean allDead()
        The function checks if all the brawlers in the lineup are dead.
        Returns:
        The method `allDead()` returns a boolean value. It returns `true` if all the `FightBrawlerFrame` objects in the `lineup` list have their `isDead` attribute set to `true`, and `false` otherwise.

      • getFrontBrawlerFrame

        protected FightBrawlerFrame getFrontBrawlerFrame()
        This function returns the first non-dead FightBrawlerFrame object in the lineup.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a non-dead `FightBrawlerFrame` object from the `lineup` list. If there are no non-dead `FightBrawlerFrame` objects in the list, it returns `null`.

      • toString

        @NonNull
public java.lang.String toString()
        This Java function returns a string representation of a lineup object by iterating through its brawlers and appending their string representations to the output.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The method is returning a string representation of the lineup of brawlers. It concatenates the string representation of each non-null brawler in the lineup and separates them with a space.
